form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service, Form 9-132-St.Paul

full_text: Form 9-132-StoPau 9-19-47 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service 1014 New Post Office Building Saint Paul 1, Minnesota January 11, 1951 File No. A6 699 884 Mr. Maoling Liu 630 Lincoln St. N. E. Minneapolis, Minnesota Dear Sir 85 Madam: The records of this Service show that the time for which you were admitted to the United States temporarily as a non-quota student will expire February 1, 1951 If you intend to continue your studies beyond that period, the enclosed application for extension of stay (Form I-535) duplicate, should be completed in every detail, after which you should bring it personally to Room 1014, New Post Office Building, St. Paul, Minnesota, any week day except Saturday or a holiday between 8:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. You should also bring the record of admission which you received at the time of entry (Form I-94), and passport or other travel document valid at least sixty days beyond the date to which you seek an extension. If you have completed your studies or expect to do so before the period of your present stay expires and you plan to leave the United States, it is requested that this letter be delivered to an officer of the Immigration and Naturalization Service at the port of departure. Very truly yours, Irvin F. Shrade Officer in Charge Assistant Officer in Charge By: William D. Perfetto P. S. If you intend to make application for an extension of your temporary stay, you must also submit a letter from the school you are attending which certifies that you are enrolled there for a full course of study. RMG/RFS
